fields.summary: CLC always return A response for AAAA or TXT DNS query

fields.description:
In many of our GA runs we are seeing that policy_api is failing with the following error (in this case when adding an account):

{code}
[root@10.111.5.123 - 08-06 00:37:28] euare-accountcreate -a engr
WARN: Load Balancing service URL is not configured.
euare-accountcreate: error: connection error
{code}

In the logs of the CLC around that time we see this:
{code}
2013-08-06 00:37:21 ERROR 000001239 Binding                  | org.jibx.runtime.JiBXException: No marshaller defined for class com.eucalyptus.vmtypes.DescribeInstanceTypesResponseType
org.jibx.runtime.JiBXException: No marshaller defined for class com.eucalyptus.vmtypes.DescribeInstanceTypesResponseType
        at org.jibx.runtime.impl.MarshallingContext.getMarshaller(MarshallingContext.java:985)
        at com.eucalyptus.vmtypes.DescribeInstanceTypesResponseType.marshal(VmTypeMessages.groovy)
        at org.jibx.runtime.impl.MarshallingContext.marshalRoot(MarshallingContext.java:1021)
        at org.jibx.runtime.impl.MarshallingContext.marshalDocument(MarshallingContext.java:1041)
        at com.eucalyptus.binding.Binding.toStream(Binding.java:195)
        at com.eucalyptus.binding.Binding.toStream(Binding.java:163)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.RestfulMarshallingHandler.outgoingMessage(RestfulMarshallingHandler.java:198)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.MessageStackHandler.handleDownstream(MessageStackHandler.java:84)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:590)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline$DefaultChannelHandlerContext.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:796)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.server.ServiceHackeryHandler.handleDownstream(ServiceHackeryHandler.java:111)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:590)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline$DefaultChannelHandlerContext.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:796)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.server.ServiceContextHandler.handleDownstream(ServiceContextHandler.java:126)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:590)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendDownstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:585)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.Channels.write(Channels.java:876)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.Channels.write(Channels.java:824)
        at com.eucalyptus.context.Contexts.response(Contexts.java:248)
        at com.eucalyptus.context.Contexts.response(Contexts.java:221)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.util.ReplyQueue.handle(ReplyQueue.java:84)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor424.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.AbstractEntryPointResolver.invokeMethod(AbstractEntryPointResolver.java:147)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.ReflectionEntryPointResolver.invoke(ReflectionEntryPointResolver.java:127)
        at org.mule.model.resolvers.DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.invoke(DefaultEntryPointResolverSet.java:50)
        at org.mule.component.DefaultLifecycleAdapter.intercept(DefaultLifecycleAdapter.java:202)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractJavaComponent.invokeComponentInstance(AbstractJavaComponent.java:82)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractJavaComponent.doOnCall(AbstractJavaComponent.java:73)
        at org.mule.component.AbstractComponent.onCall(AbstractComponent.java:87)
        at org.mule.model.seda.SedaService$ComponentStageWorker.run(SedaService.java:533)
        at org.mule.work.WorkerContext.run(WorkerContext.java:310)
        at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:665)
{code}

Machines are available for debugging here:
10.111.5.123
10.111.5.124

SOSreport attached for both machines.
fields.summary: DNS lookup sometimes fails with experimental DNS

comments.body: The JiBX error message is harmless, see EUCA-7174.

Adding additional log/debug info from another QA test which failed in a similar manner (no response from the CLC. In this case a describe instances request). Not sure what the vmware portion is as this is not using vmware. I 'think' this was also seen in the failure [~viglesias] reported above, but was not included in the log snippet. 
Thanks,
-M

TEST: maint-storage-EMC-kvm
Instance tests ->'Policy Engine' test failure in describe instances:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/qa-testunit/3231/console

TEST MEMO:
GIT_REPO	git+ssh://repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com/internal#maint/3.3/testing
GIT_HASH	6df8588a3ba3c411c5dcbd94ebd71e97c8ebb654

10.111.5.127	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[CLC WS CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.129	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[NC00]

MEMO
CLOUD_OPTS=--debug

EXTRA_REPO=pgrpms http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/euca-master-bootstrap/rhel/6/x86_64/
EXTRA_REPO=elrepo http://mirror.eucalyptus-systems.com/mirrors/elrepo/el6/x86_64/
USE_EPEL_REPO=YES

LOCAL_EUCA2OOLS_REPO=http://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/gholms/cloud/epel-6/x86_64/
EBS_STORAGE_MANAGER=SANManager
SAN_PROVIDER=EmcVnxProvider

SET_VNET_NETMASK=255.255.192.0 
#########################################################################
#########################################################################

Note that DNS is enabled on the GA runs now and it may be the DNS resolution is failing for this particular call. Not sure if it makes a difference or not but something to keep in mind.

A community user reported an issue with almost the same stack , following is the link to that Q&A post

https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/1414529-java-error-no-marshaller-degined-

I have reproduced this issue when using DNS, but not when using the IP of the service. Presumably any command will work, but I tested with account creation:

{code}
for N in {1..10000}; do euare-accountcreate -a foo$N; if [ $? -ne 0  ]; then break; fi; sleep .1; done
{code}

The error occurs around once every 1000 requests.

Adding some extra logging to euca2ools shows the underlying error is:

{code}
2013-08-12 15:59:57,546 ERROR   Euare connection error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 203, in send_request
    data, headers)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 287, in __log_and_send_request
    timeout=self.timeout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 374, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 206, in send
    raise ConnectionError(sockerr)
ConnectionError: [Errno -2] Name or service not known
{code}

I'll attach packet captures for successful and unsuccessful invocations.

One thing that is particular about this testcase that we are seeing this is that the client machine is the CLC itself. What I see in the successful case is:

For the A record:
1) t=0 CLC (the client) sends request to Main DNS
2) t=.4ms Main DNS sends response to CLC (the client)

In the fail case i see:
1)  t=0 Main DNS sends request to CLC (the delegated subdomain server) (I THINK THIS SHOULD BE IGNORED BUT CANT BE SURE)
2)  t=162.0ms CLC (the delegated subdomain server) sends response to Main DNS
3)  t=162.5ms Main DNS sends response to CLC (the client)
4)  t=162.6ms  CLC (the client) sends request to Main DNS
5)  t=163.2ms Main DNS responds with No such name

I don't exactly know how to interpret this timeline any further.  I may need help from [~decker] or [~nurmi] to figure out more info.

Attached captures with only the DNS packets (*_2.pcap). This is one success and one failure with similar message exchanges.

It looks like the issue occurs when the queries for A and AAAA records are performed in a different order.
It looks like the cause of the issue is responding with an A record for an AAAA query. Tests with this behaviour corrected are not showing the problem so far.

Example of AAAA query showing incorrect response with an A record (current behaviour):

{code}
# dig @10.111.5.147 euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.5 <<>> @10.111.5.147 euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 46785
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN AAAA

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. 60 IN A 10.111.5.147

;; Query time: 110 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.5.147#53(10.111.5.147)
;; WHEN: Wed Aug 14 10:58:35 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 81
{code}

Example of AAAA query with fix in place:

{code}
# dig @10.111.5.147 euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.17.rc1.el6_4.5 <<>> @10.111.5.147 euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 26105
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euare.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN AAAA

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. 604800 IN SOA root.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. g-05-12.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.g-05-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. 1 86400 604800 2419200 600

;; Query time: 65 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.5.147#53(10.111.5.147)
;; WHEN: Wed Aug 14 10:56:29 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 141
{code}
